snippet: Colin Myler, editor of The Daily News and former editor of The News of the World, was targeted in a British parliamentary panel’s report on the phone-hacking scandal.

byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: As a newspaper editor who has commanded troops on both sides of New York's pungent tabloid wars, Colin Myler has always shown a thirst for the eye-popping story and a willingness to take the heat to run something that will sell, sell, sell. In the four months since he became editor of The Daily News, Mr. Myler, 59, has made it clear that he identifies with the sensibilities of the common man.

headline.main: With Report, a Tabloid Editor Is Again Part of the Story

keywords.value: WIRETAPPING AND OTHER EAVESDROPPING DEVICES AND METHODS
